questions: How many floating operations are being performed in your reduction kernel? explain.
How many global memory reads are being performed by your kernel? explain.
How many global memory writes are being performed by your kernel? explain.
What is the minimum, maximum, and average number of real operations that a thread will perform? Real operations are those that directly contribute to the final reduction value.
How many times does a single thread block synchronize to reduce its portion of the array to a single value?
Describe what optimizations were performed to your kernel to achieve a performance speedup.
Describe what further optimizations can be implemented to your kernel to achieve a performance speedup.
Suppose the input is greater than 2048*6535, what modifications are needed to your kernel?
Suppose a you want to scan using a a binary operator that's not commutative, can you use a parallel reduction for that?
Is it possible to get different results from running the serial version and parallel version of reduction? explain.
